document_title: Cervical cancer: Causes, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Depending on the type of cervical cancer, patients are prescribed different treatment methods:
Squamous cell carcinoma: A form of cancer that starts in the thin, flat cells lining the outer part of the cervix. According to statistics, this is the most common form of cervical cancer, about 80 - 85% of all cases, caused by infection with human papilloma virus (HPV).; Adenocarcinoma: A form of cancer that occurs in the glandular cells of the upper part of the cervix, accounting for about 10 - 20% of all cases.; Other forms of cervical cancer such as small cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, squamous cell adenocarcinoma, lymphoma, melanoma... are often unrelated. to the HPV papilloma virus, which is less common but cannot be prevented like squamous cell carcinoma.
